Date: Wednesday, August 26, 2020

When you RSVP, please include the child's name, parent/guardian name and contact information (cell/home phone number). No student will be able to attend if they did not RSVP to the parent committee.

We look forward to seeing you all then!

Attention Parents/Guardians that have a child entering the 6th Grade. Please see below for an important message from Memorial Middle School Principal, Mr. Robert Porfido...

6th Grade students that have not submitted proof of the required immunizations for entering 6th Grade will not be permitted to enter school on the first day of school. This is a state mandated regulation. You must submit written proof from your physician that your child has received their required immunizations, or that they have a scheduled appointment to do so within the first two weeks of school. Failure to do so will result in your child being placed into the full remote learning platform for the first trimester of school.

Please see the district website for the required immunizations for all students entering 6th Grade or click on the link below.

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation.

Little Ferry
March 30 at 9:21 PM ·

Dear Little Ferry Family,

Many towns with local hospitals have decided to do clap outs in honor of the medical personnel and first responders who have and continue to sacrifice so much for our health and safety. In keeping with that spirit of appreciation for these heroes -- tomorrow evening, Tuesday, March 31st at 7 pm sharp, I’m respectfully asking all Little Ferry residents to clap outside their front door or windows for 2 minutes. I will also be asking local churches to ring their bells. Also, if you have one at home -- let’s all hang or fly the flag of the United States of America outside our homes as a sign of our unity. Stay healthy and safe!

Mayor Mauro Raguseo

The following is an important message for Parents/Guardians from our I.T. Department regarding Chromebooks...

Cleaning/Sanitizing Chromebooks

For 7th and 8th Grade students who take their computers home, the recommended method of cleaning the surfaces and screen are as follows:

Lysol wipes are the preferred choice for the keyboard and screen. They may leave a "haze" on the screens, so you can buff the haze off with a clean microfiber cloth if necessary. If the Lysol wipe is extremely wet, wring it out slightly before using. Other wipes can be used, however, DO NOT use any cleaners that contain bleach and DO NOT spray any cleaners directly on the keyboard or screen.

The Chromebooks that are not part of the take home program will be cleaned frequently by staff and/or students.
